text: Hi everyone, new here and very new to HubL so go easy on me please :slightly_smiling_face:! I've been trying to customize a quote template but the examples given are quite simple and don't contain all the information we would like to display on the quote. When learning about HubL on the academy the tutor mentioned that we had access to all the variables available on the page in a JSON format via a sprocket menu on the published page, unfortunately I don't see this menu anywhere. Is there a way to find out what values are available and where can I get them from? Thank you.
The quote templates are a beta feature and do not support the sprocket menu you see in CMS pages. Generally the same data is available for quotes as a normal page, some differences apply.
Most of the variables on the hubl supported variables page are supported for instance
Thank you for your help <@U7SL518D6> I will look into them. Is there a reference I should look into other than <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/tags|this> for the JSON data?
I was referring to the hubl supported variables page. At this time you cant place modules or custom modules onto a quotes template and edit them at the individual quote level.
